frameDefinitions: This frame contains words that describe specific aspects of a Color.
This frame covers LUs that describe the race of a Person.
A Theme is held in captivity by an Agent or Cause.
A Color serves as a landmark in color-space, either a point-like landmark (e.g. burnt sienna) or a broader region (e.g. blue).
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
A Material has been processed (generally industrially) to some Degree in order to make it more useful for some (usually implicit) function.
frameExamples: Carlos is <t>hispanic</t>, or so he says.
Twenty soldiers were in <t>captivity</t> for over a month before they were released
I really like that shade of <t>blue</t>.
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
listRoleDefinitions: The color that is being described.
The entity whose <fen>Color</fen> is being described.
The Person whose race is being described.
The area within which the <fen>Theme</fen> is confined.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive.
This role identifies the <fen>Entity</fen> described by the <fen>Color</fen>.
A position in color-space, generally used to describe the quality of some <fen>Entity</fen>.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The substance which is altered in some useful way.
listRoleExamples: Fornalutx is a jewel of warm <fex>stone</fex>.
<fex>He</fex> was in captivity for six days.
The captives <fex>in the next room</fex> were fed well but otherwise ignored.
She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
